title: Met Police officers working for Andrew told to guard Epstein's home, emails show
partialText: The Met says it has not identified any wrongdoing by its protection officers "at this time".

title: 'Effective' SEND support won't be taken away, minister says
partialText: But the education secretary says children "will be reviewed in terms of their needs", under planned reforms.

title: Explosions kill police officer and injure 25 in western Ukraine
partialText: Twenty-five people were injured by explosions overnight in what officials are calling a terror attack.

title: We thought Gen Z had started going to church in droves. But the truth is more complicated
partialText: A fierce debate is taking place about whether there really has been a revival in Christianity.

title: Can you name every GB medal winner at Milan-Cortina?

title: Penis injections, swearing curlers and a wolfdog - Olympic stories you might have missed

title: How sister's success paved way for Atkin's bronze
partialText: Freestyle skier Zoe Atkin wins bronze in the women's halfpipe to secure Great Britain's fifth medal at the 2026 Winter Olympics, equalling the team's record-best haul.

partialText: The biggest night in the British film calendar is upon us - find out who's nominated and how to watch.

title: Are ties and blazers on the way out? Why some schools are pushing for 'active' uniforms
partialText: Proponents say relaxed uniforms make life easier for children and are much more practical for physical play.

title: Andrew is Prince William's problem too - and it makes his future job harder
partialText: Andrew's arrest has changed the public's view of the Royal Family, putting pressure on Prince William as he moves closer to being king.

title: I cleaned toilets while studying at Cambridge
partialText: Jade Franks uses her experience of classism to write a hit play which has been picked up by Netflix.

title: The most played music artists for UK cities - some may surprise you
partialText: Spotify and YouTube's streaming data for 2025 shows some interesting variations in listening habits.

title: Former PM Gordon Brown urges police probe into whether Andrew used RAF bases to meet Epstein

title: Explosions kill police officer and injure 25 in western Ukraine
partialText: Twenty-five people were injured by explosions overnight in what officials are calling a terror attack.

title: Iran students stage first large anti-government protests since deadly crackdown
partialText: Student protesters honoured thousands of those killed when nationwide mass protests were put down by Iranian authorities last month.

title: I didn't know I was experiencing burnout until it was too late
partialText: Studies show burnout in young people is rising and there are a number of reasons why.

title: Victim killed in skate park double stabbing named
partialText: Mason Miller, 20, was killed on Wednesday when he was fatally stabbed, detectives say.

title: US ambassador's Israel comments condemned by Arab and Muslim nations
partialText: Mike Huckabee suggested Israel would be justified in taking much of the Middle East on Biblical grounds.

title: 13,000 calls in three months: How one city is keeping ahead of measles
partialText: Nurses and doctors are trying to understand and assuage the concerns some patients have over vaccines.

title: Tributes paid to 'amazing' men aged 19 and 20 who died on Yr Wyddfa
partialText: They have been named locally as Jayden Long, 19, and Eddie Hill, 20, from Norfolk.

title: 'We want the truth' - families of Nottingham attacks victims speak ahead of public inquiry
partialText: An inquiry into the attacks carried out by Valdo Calocane will hear evidence in London from Monday.

title: 'It is a catastrophe' - the man battling to stem rising youth unemployment
partialText: Alan Milburn returns to his hometown of Newcastle as he undertakes a review into the growing numbers of young people out of work.

title: Son lived with mum's body for months after Covid lockdown let him hide murder
partialText: Judith Rhead was bludgeoned to death by her son, who was meant to be her carer during Covid.

title: Tories vow to lower interest on some student loans
partialText: Kemi Badenoch says graduates feel 'stitched up' as she promises to cut Plan 2 loan interest charges.

title: My bagpipes dream landed me thousands of followers. A rare chronic illness left me unable to play
partialText: Katie Robertson went back and forth to her GP and local hospital before being diagnosed with postural tachycardia syndrome.

title: Pop star's 50-year search for his birth father
partialText: The musician, who was born in a mother and baby home, only found out who his natural father was when he was 59.

title: Woman's fox rescue forges unusual bond
partialText: An injured fox is nursed back to life thanks to a "strong connection" with a Hackney resident.

title: Ryan Reynolds' sweary reaction to Wrexham drawing Chelsea in the FA Cup

title: England bowlers secure crucial win over Sri Lanka
partialText: A superb bowling performance ignites England's T20 World Cup campaign as Harry Brook's side beat co-hosts Sri Lanka by 51 runs.
